question: ___ of the students were late to the class, but ___ was on time.
description: 'Some' is used to refer to a part of a group, and 'none' indicates that no one from that group was on time.

question: ___ of the project is completed, but ___ tasks are still pending.
description: 'Half' refers to 50% of the project being completed, and 'some' indicates that there are still pending tasks.

question: ___ employee forgot to submit ___ report, but ___ other employees did the same.
description: 'Each' refers to every individual in the group, 'the' specifies a particular report, and 'no' indicates that no other employees forgot the report.

question: ___ of the cake was left uneaten, and ___ of the guests had already left.
description: 'Much' refers to the quantity of the cake that was left, and 'most' indicates the majority of guests had left.

question: I have ___ apples, but ___ of them are ripe yet.
description: 'A few' indicates a small number of apples, and 'none' shows that none of them are ripe yet.

question: ___ of the options are available, and ___ is the most suitable for the project.
description: 'All' refers to the complete set of options, and 'one' is the most suitable among them.

question: ___ of the time, ___ would find the solution, but ___ seems to be different.
description: 'Most' indicates a large portion of the time, 'we' refers to the group that would typically find the solution, and 'this' refers to the current situation.

question: ___ time I visit my grandparents, ___ ask me about my studies.
description: 'Every' refers to all instances of visiting, and 'they' is used to refer to the grandparents who ask about the studies.

question: ___ cake is too sweet for my taste, but ___ might be just right.
description: 'This' refers to the cake in front of the speaker, and 'that' refers to another cake which might be more suitable.

question: ___ of the research has been published, and ___ is yet to be reviewed.
description: 'Some' indicates part of the research has been published, while 'much' signifies a large amount of research is still pending review.

question: ___ books on the shelf are rare editions, and ___ of them are worth a lot.
description: 'All' refers to every book being a rare edition, and 'some' indicates a portion of these books are highly valuable.

question: ___ people in the room are familiar to me, but ___ are new faces.
description: 'Many' indicates a large number of familiar people, and 'some' refers to the people who are unfamiliar.

question: ___ students in the class passed the exam with ___ grade.
description: 'Most' refers to the majority of students, and 'a high' describes the quality of the grade they achieved.

question: ___ of the answers provided were correct, but ___ were completely wrong.
description: 'Some' refers to a portion of the answers being correct, and 'none' indicates that no answers were completely wrong.

question: ___ of the room was decorated for the party, and ___ of the guests arrived early.
description: 'Half' indicates that a part of the room was decorated, and 'some' shows that not all guests arrived early.

question: I need ___ information to complete the report, but ___ provided is insufficient.
description: 'More' indicates the need for additional information, and 'what was' refers to the insufficient information already provided.

question: ___ of the cake did you eat? I ate ___ slice myself.
description: 'How much' asks for a quantity of an uncountable noun (cake), and 'one' refers to a countable slice.

question: ___ is necessary for the recipe, but ___ is too much to handle.
description: 'A little' refers to a small but sufficient amount, while 'much' indicates an excessive quantity.

question: ___ of the audience enjoyed the performance, but ___ left before it ended.
description: 'Most' refers to the majority of the audience, and 'some' indicates that a part of the audience left early.

question: ___ of the participants completed the survey, and ___ found it helpful.
description: 'All' indicates every participant completed the survey, and 'most' suggests that the majority found it helpful.

question: ___ of the issues have been addressed, but ___ are still pending.
description: 'Many' refers to a large number of issues addressed, while 'some' indicates that a portion are still unresolved.

question: ___ of the information was incorrect, and ___ of it was useful.
description: 'Most' refers to the majority of information being incorrect, and 'some' indicates a portion was useful.

question: ___ students completed their assignments on time, and ___ had to ask for extensions.
description: 'All' indicates every student completed their assignments, while 'some' had to request extensions.

question: ___ of the meeting was productive, but ___ was spent discussing minor issues.
description: 'Most' refers to the productive part of the meeting, and 'some' indicates time spent on less important issues.

question: ___ of these solutions are viable, but ___ requires further investigation.
description: 'Several' solutions are viable, while 'one' requires additional scrutiny.

question: ___ people volunteered for the event, and ___ of them had prior experience.
description: 'A few' volunteered, and 'some' of them had prior experience.

question: ___ of the answers were correct, but ___ of them were partially correct.
description: 'Most' answers were correct, and 'some' were partially correct.

question: ___ of the room was decorated with lights, and ___ of the furniture was rearranged.
description: 'Half' of the room was decorated, and 'most' of the furniture was rearranged.

question: ___ of the paintings were sold at the auction, but ___ remained unsold.
description: 'Many' paintings were sold, and 'a few' remained unsold.

question: ___ of the project was completed on time, and ___ of the tasks are still in progress.
description: 'Most' of the project was completed on time, and 'some' tasks are still ongoing.

question: ___ of the staff were involved in the training session, and ___ missed it.
description: 'All' staff were involved in the training, while 'some' missed it.

question: ___ of the committee members voted in favor of the proposal, and ___ opposed it.
description: 'Most' voted in favor, while 'a few' opposed the proposal.

question: ___ of the new policies have been implemented, but ___ are still under review.
description: 'Some' policies have been put into action, while 'others' are still being reviewed.

question: ___ of the ingredients are needed for the recipe, but ___ are optional.
description: 'Most' of the ingredients are necessary, and 'some' are optional.

question: ___ of the team members contributed to the report, and ___ had no input.
description: 'All' contributed, while 'some' team members did not provide any input.
